page.title: 06Problem sheep
page.content: There is only one crofter in Torridon who keeps sheep.As there is no common grazing there should be no sheep wandering in Fasaig.The local crofter keeps his sheep within the croft land providing them with supplementary feeding such as hay, cereals (barley & maize),ewe & lamb mix,cake etc.He also keeps his sheep numbers to what the land can support. He has to pay 50p a head levy to the N.T. However,crofters in the neighbouring villages keep more sheep than their land can support and do not provide sufficient extra feed, So they allow their sheep to wander to this area to find extra grazing feed. This causes damage to gardens & fences and fouls the public road and grass areas.Children and pets get ticks off the sheep.Excreta is carried on feet into buildings causing nuisance dirt. So far hydatid is not prevalent here.
